title: Open-Loop vs Closed-Loop Comparison
description: Interactive side-by-side comparison demonstrating how feedback control enables superior disturbance rejection compared to open-loop systems. Students apply disturbances and observe how each architecture responds.
creator: Claude AI
subject: Control Systems
Feedback Control
Engineering
learningObjectives: Differentiate between open-loop and closed-loop control architectures
Analyze why feedback enables automatic disturbance rejection
Predict how controller gain affects disturbance rejection capability
prerequisites: Basic understanding of control system terminology

controls.label: Apply Disturbance
controls.description: Applies a step disturbance at t = 3 seconds to both systems

controls.label: Disturbance d
controls.description: Sets the magnitude of the step disturbance

controls.label: CL Gain K
controls.description: Sets the controller gain for the closed-loop system

modelType: First-order dynamic system with proportional control
limitations: Only proportional control (no integral or derivative action)
